Package akka.http.scaladsl.server.directives

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AttributeDirectives
    Extracts a request attribute value for the given key.
    AuthenticationDirective<T>
    Returns a copy of this AuthenticationDirective that will provide Some(user) if credentials were supplied and otherwise None.
    BasicDirectives  
    CacheConditionDirectives
    Wraps its inner route with support for Conditional Requests as defined by http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232 In particular the algorithm defined by http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-6 is implemented by this directive.
    CachingDirectives
    Wraps its inner Route with caching support using the given Cache implementation and keyer function.
    CodingDirectives
    Rejects the request with an UnacceptedResponseEncodingRejection if the given response encoding is not accepted by the client.
    CompleteOrRecoverWithMagnet  
    ContentTypeResolver
    Check against directory traversal attempts by making sure that the final is a "true child" of the given base directory.
    CookieDirectives
    Extracts the HttpCookiePair with the given name.
    Credentials
    Represents authentication credentials supplied with a request.
    DebuggingDirectives
    Produces a log entry for every incoming request.
    ExecutionDirectives
    Transforms exceptions thrown during evaluation of its inner route using the given ExceptionHandler.
    FileAndResourceDirectives
    Completes GET requests with the content of the given file.
    FileAndResourceDirectives.DirectoryRenderer  
    FileAndResourceDirectives.LowLevelDirectoryRenderer  
    FileUploadDirectives
    Streams the bytes of the file submitted using multipart with the given file name into a designated file on disk.
    FormFieldDirectives
    Extracts HTTP form fields from the request as a Map[String, String].
    FormFieldDirectives.FieldDef<T> Deprecated
    Use new `formFields` overloads with FieldSpec parameters.
    FormFieldDirectives.FieldMagnet Deprecated
    Use new `formField` overloads with FieldSpec parameters.
    FormFieldDirectives.FieldSpec  
    FormFieldDirectivesInstances
    Extracts query parameter values from the request.
    FramedEntityStreamingDirectives
    Extracts entity as Source of elements of type T.
    FutureDirectives
    "Unwraps" a Future[T] and runs the inner route after future completion with the future's value as an extraction of type Try[T].
    HeaderDirectives
    Checks that request comes from the same origin.
    HeaderMagnet<T>
    Returns a partial function that checks if the input value is of runtime type T and returns the value if it does.
    HostDirectives
    Extracts the hostname part of the Host request header value.
    LowPriorityHeaderMagnetImplicits
    If possible we want to apply the special logic for ModeledCustomHeader to extract custom headers by type, otherwise the default fromCompanion is good enough (for headers that the parser emits in the right type already).
    MarshallingDirectives
    Unmarshalls the requests entity to the given type passes it to its inner Route.
    MethodDirectives
    Rejects all non-DELETE requests.
    MiscDirectives
    Checks the given condition before running its inner route.
    OnSuccessMagnet  
    ParameterDirectives
    Extracts the request's query parameters as a Map[String, String].
    ParameterDirectives.ParamDef<T> Deprecated
    Use new `parameters` overloads with ParamSpec parameters.
    ParameterDirectives.ParamMagnet Deprecated
    Use new `parameters` overloads with ParamSpec parameters.
    ParameterDirectives.ParamSpec  
    ParameterDirectivesInstances
    Extracts query parameter values from the request.
    PathDirectives
    Applies the given PathMatcher to the remaining unmatched path after consuming a leading slash.
    RangeDirectives
    Answers GET requests with an Accept-Ranges: bytes header and converts HttpResponses coming back from its inner route into partial responses if the initial request contained a valid Range request header.
    RespondWithDirectives
    Unconditionally adds the given response header to all HTTP responses of its inner Route.
    RouteDirectives
    Rejects the request with an empty set of rejections.
    SchemeDirectives
    Extracts the Uri scheme from the request.
    SecurityDirectives
    The result of an HTTP authentication attempt is either the user object or an HttpChallenge to present to the browser.
    TimeoutDirectives
    Return the currently set request timeout.
    WebSocketDirectives
    Extract the UpgradeToWebSocket header if existent.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AttributeDirectives$
    Extracts an optional request attribute for the given key.
    AuthenticationDirective$
    Returns a copy of this AuthenticationDirective that uses the given object as the anonymous user which will be used if no credentials were supplied in the request.
    AuthenticationResult
    Safely compares the passed in secret with the received secret part of the Credentials.
    AuthenticationResult$
    Safely compares the passed in secret with the received secret part of the Credentials.
    BasicDirectives$
    WARNING: This will read the entire request entity into memory and effectively disable streaming.
    CacheConditionDirectives$
    Wraps its inner route with support for Conditional Requests as defined by http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232 In particular the algorithm defined by http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-6 is implemented by this directive.
    CachingDirectives$
    Creates an LfuCache.
    CodingDirectives$
    Inspects the response entity and adds a Content-Encoding: gzip response header if the entity's media-type is precompressed with gzip and no Content-Encoding header is present yet.
    CompleteOrRecoverWithMagnet$  
    ContentTypeResolver$
    The default way of resolving a filename to a ContentType is by looking up the file extension in the registry of all defined media-types.
    CookieDirectives$
    Adds a Set-Cookie response header expiring the cookie with the given properties.
    Credentials.Missing$  
    Credentials.Provided  
    Credentials.Provided$  
    Credentials$
    First applies the passed in hasher function to the received secret part of the Credentials and then safely compares the passed in secret with the hashed received secret.
    DebuggingDirectives$
    Produces a log entry for every incoming request and RouteResult.
    DirectoryListing
    The default way of resolving a filename to a ContentType is by looking up the file extension in the registry of all defined media-types.
    DirectoryListing$  
    ExecutionDirectives$
    Transforms rejections produced by its inner route using the given RejectionHandler.
    FileAndResourceDirectives.DirectoryRenderer$  
    FileAndResourceDirectives.ResourceFile  
    FileAndResourceDirectives.ResourceFile$  
    FileAndResourceDirectives$
    Given a base directory and a (Uri) path, returns a path to a location contained in the base directory, while checking that no path traversal is possible.
    FileInfo
    Additional metadata about the file being uploaded/that was uploaded using the FileUploadDirectives param: fieldName Name of the form field the file was uploaded in param: fileName User specified name of the uploaded file param: contentType Content type of the file
    FileInfo$  
    FileUploadDirectives$
    Collects each body part that is a multipart file as a tuple containing metadata and a Source for streaming the file contents somewhere.
    FormFieldDirectives.FieldDef$ Deprecated
    Use new `formFields` overloads with FieldSpec parameters.
    FormFieldDirectives.FieldDef$.ConvertFieldDefAndConcatenate$  
    FormFieldDirectives.FieldMagnet$ Deprecated
    Use new `formField` overloads with FieldSpec parameters.
    FormFieldDirectives.FieldSpec$  
    FormFieldDirectives.Impl$  
    FormFieldDirectives$
    Extracts a number of HTTP form field from the request.
    FutureDirectives$
    "Unwraps" a Future[T] and runs the inner route when the future has failed with the future's failure exception as an extraction of type Throwable.
    HeaderDirectives$
    Extract the header value of the optional HTTP request header with the given type.
    HeaderMagnet$
    If possible we want to apply the special logic for ModeledCustomHeader to extract custom headers by type, otherwise the default fromCompanion is good enough (for headers that the parser emits in the right type already).
    HostDirectives$
    Rejects all requests with a host name that doesn't have a prefix matching the given regular expression.
    LogEntry  
    LogEntry$  
    LoggingMagnet<T>  
    LoggingMagnet$  
    MarshallingDirectives$
    Completes the request using the given function.
    MethodDirectives$
    Changes the HTTP method of the request to the value of the specified query string parameter.
    MiscDirectives$
    Disables the size limit (configured by akka.http.parsing.max-content-length by default) checking on the incoming HttpRequest entity.
    OnSuccessMagnet$  
    ParameterDirectives.ParamDef$ Deprecated
    Use new `parameters` overloads with ParamSpec parameters.
    ParameterDirectives.ParamDef$.ConvertParamDefAndConcatenate$  
    ParameterDirectives.ParamMagnet$ Deprecated
    Use new `parameters` overloads with ParamSpec parameters.
    ParameterDirectives.ParamSpec$  
    ParameterDirectives$
    Actual directive implementations shared between old and new API
    PathDirectives.TrailingRetryRejection$  
    PathDirectives$
    INTERNAL API
    RangeDirectives$
    Answers GET requests with an Accept-Ranges: bytes header and converts HttpResponses coming back from its inner route into partial responses if the initial request contained a valid Range request header.
    RespondWithDirectives$
    Adds the given response headers to all HTTP responses of its inner Route, if a header already exists it is not added again.
    RouteDirectives$
    Handle the request using a synchronous partial function.
    SchemeDirectives$
    Rejects all requests whose Uri scheme does not match the given one.
    SecurityDirectives$
    Asynchronous version of authorize.
    TimeoutDirectives$
    Tries to set a new request timeout handler, which produces the timeout response for a given request.
